items.title: Remote IT/Technical Recruiter
items.content:
This is a remote position Full lifecycle recruiting - sourcing, processing candidates to hire Perform end-to-end recruitment in line with client requirements, liaising with the team. Fill approved open positions in alignment with business objectives. Source and pre-qualify candidates that match client requirements.
Pay rate: 35. 00/hr

items.title: Worldwide, REMOTE, full time or part time -- 100% flexibility. $70-100/hr. Expert Interviewer at Karat (https://karat.io) Work ...
items.content:
Worldwide, REMOTE, full time or part time -- 100% flexibility. $70-100/hr. Expert Interviewer at Karat (https://karat.io)

Work from anywhere in the world that has a solid internet connection. Work as much or as little as you want. Work any day, any time of day, any number of hours -- you can do 0 one week, 50 the next week, and back to 0 the next week. Only requirement there is that we want you to roughly average at least 10 hours a week, or else the training/time investment doesn't make as much sense from your end or ours.

I know the above might sound a little strange, so a bit about the company for context: Karat is a Seattle-based startup that does software engineering interviews on behalf of other companies -- primarily first-round phone screens. Quickly-growing companies can spend a significant fraction of their engineers' time interviewing; we help take the load off. We've done a lot to make the interview experience better for all stakeholders that I could write whole essays about, but suffice it to say that candidates love working with us, clients love working with us, and we're well-funded and growing quickly as a result.

Because of this quickly-growing demand, we're looking to hire more Expert Interviewers. The ideal candidate is a software engineer with strong written and verbal English skills with at least a few years of professional experience. Interviewing experience would be great, but we spend 25 hours (paid) training you before you even start, so if you're strong technically and love working with people we can usually make it work :) Interviews are conducted over video chat, using a collaborative code editor.

Some of our interviewers are freelancers who use our scheduling model to backfill hours; others are full timers at top tech companies looking to make some extra cash; others have quit their jobs to work with us full time; some are digital nomads; one of our interviewers is road tripping around North America for a year and a half, doing anywhere from zero to 40 interviews each week depending on where he is and what the weather's like.

The application form is here: https://jobs.lever.co/karat/d44ab283-c7c0-4bbd-b8c3-4dc0ced6...

I know it's a pretty unique job, so if you have any questions reply here or email me at josh@karat.io and I'm happy to talk through any of it.

P.S. We're also hiring for our internal team -- particularly looking for senior engineers right now; for those we generally prefer local (Seattle) candidates, though we do cover relocation. More details on those here: https://karat.io/careers, or feel free to email me if you have any questions.

items.title: High-Tech Executive Recruiting Contractor
items.content:
High-Tech Executive Recruiting Contractor at CyberEdge Group

Remote | Freelance
  • Washington, DC, USA
  • Contract

LOCATION:

Your home office anywhere in the United States

DESCRIPTION:

CyberEdge Group (http://www.cyber-edge.com) is an award-winning marketing and research consulting firm serving software and hardware vendors in the high-tech industry. Our clients are the “who’s who” of the IT world, including Microsoft, HPE, Dell, VMware, Red Hat, Citrix, Juniper, Palo Alto Networks, and dozens more.

CyberEdge is currently recruiting experienced high-tech executive recruiting contractors based in the United States to service our 80+ clients. Responsibilities may include:

  • Contingent-based (commission only) searches for high-tech vendor marketing personnel, including:
    • CMO or VP / Director of marketing
    • Product marketing managers
    • Product managers
    • Marketing communications managers
    • Corporate communications managers
    • Channel marketing managers
    • Event marketing managers
  • Provide a variety of recruiting services on a retainer basis for 20, 30, or 40 hours per week for a minimum of three months

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Minimum of 10 years of high-tech recruiting experience
  • B.S. or B.A. undergraduate degree
  • An existing network of high-tech marketing personnel
  • Ability to fully understand position requirements and candidate prerequisites
  • Willingness to screen candidates by phone prior to client submission
  • Excellent communication and client-management skills
  • Available home office space with computer, software, printer, and Internet access

BENEFITS:

  • Competitive compensation – CyberEdge consultants are well compensated and don’t need to invest non-billable time locating new projects.
  • Frequent projects – CyberEdge is growing rapidly. Once you’re assigned to an account, repeat projects are consistently assigned to you.
  • Reliable payments – CyberEdge contractors are always paid on time, usually within 7 to 10 days of invoice receipt.
  • Work at home – CyberEdge contractors work primarily from their home offices throughout the United States.
  • Flexible work hours – Most of our client engagements enable you to set your own schedule.
Apply for job

Human Resources and Recruiting Coordinator Job at ConsenSys - AngelList
  • ConsenSys
  • Product
  • Jobs
  • Team
Applied
Apply Now
Add a message to ConsenSys
Apply
Share

Human Resources and Recruiting Coordinator at ConsenSys

Brooklyn, Remote · Full Time
We're a fluid organization comprised of deep thinkers from a variety of backgrounds.Read More

We're a fluid organization comprised of deep thinkers from a variety of backgrounds.

We're passionate about our work and are looking to find others who are interested in building solutions for an emerging, digitally-integrated economy. 

Please see our website for current opportunities. https://consensys.net/open-positions/

Applied
Apply to ConsenSys
Add a message to ConsenSys
Apply

Job Description

Apply Here:

ConsenSys is a venture production studio focused on building and scaling tools and enterprise software products powered by Ethereum. Our mission is to use these solutions to power the emerging economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet.

Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, the music industry, security and infrastructure, and more. To accomplish this, we’ve built out a flat organizational structure which we call the ConsenSys Mesh; a network of individuals & teams working autonomously and towards the same goal. The MeshOps team is responsible for designing and implementing “Meshocracy”, our own operational & company structure loosely based on the principles of holacracy. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.

The Role

The Human Resources and Recruiting Coordinator is an integral member of our team! We need help telling our story around the world! In this role you will develop a solid foundation of knowledge and experience as part of a greater global team serving countless internal customers and projects on 6 continents. You will have the opportunity to build candidate relationships, and partner with recruiters, human resources and hiring managers. The ideal candidate seeks career growth within Recruiting and/or Human Resources and will provide support in many different areas. This is truly a choose your own destiny situation, and a chance for ownership. This role will grow and evolve as ConsenSys grows and incolves

Build excellent relationships across our organization
Create welcome packages and kits for new hires
Coordinate interview activities on-campus and in-house including, but not limited to, scheduling and calendar invites; interview confirmation emails; reserving interview rooms and telephone/video conference (when necessary); and candidate debrief calls/meetings
Schedule and coordinate logistics for all campus recruiting events, e.g. RSVPs, payment/check requests, calendar invites, etc.
Manage inventory for all recruiting swag and ensure all swag is readily available.
Coordinate offer letter process and as well as onboarding set-up
Provide support on special projects and initiatives
Assist with the internship program and internal events
Assist with wellness endeavors
Required Skills:

Meticulous attention to detail and strong organizational skills with proven ability to prioritize and complete projects within deadlines
Self-starter who loves taking initiative
Creative problem solver
Discreet and able to manage sensitive information
Flexibility, high energy and a positive attitude
Prior experience in a Recruiting or Human Resources department is preferred
Familiarity with applicant tracking systems, HR systems and social media is preferred
Ability to focus on the details, but also understand the bigger picture
Bonus Points:

Interest in new technology, Blockchain, and/or Ethereum
Humble, kind, and doesn't take themselves too seriously

Compensation
$50K–$55K
0.01%–0.01%
Visa Sponsorship
Available
Applied
Apply Now
Add a message to ConsenSys
Apply

What We're Building

ConsenSys is a blockchain venture production studio building decentralized applications, mostly on Ethereum. We are currently building foundational tools for emerging business models in the cryptocurrency or Bitcoin 2.0 space. These tools will be packaged into separate ventures that are individually funded and skinned for different business niches.

ConsenSys is presently comprised of a number of core personnel — some of whom are based in New York City, but several are in other cities around the world — who are focussed on the identification, acquisition, and development of talent and projects, in addition to the development of our own internal projects and some focus on consulting work.

ConsenSys spawns, coordinates, incubates and accelerates single purpose vehicles (SPVs) through internal development, acquisitions, investments, or the formation of joint ventures.

Hiring in Brooklyn, Remote OK

items.title: Clevertech: Talent Acquisition Manager
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Talent Acquisition Manager

Company: Clevertech
Headquarters: Remote
https://www.clevertech.biz/

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is currently seeking a Manager of Talent Acquisition to join our Recruiting team. This is an exciting opportunity for anyone interested in a career in People Operations within an organization that will provide opportunities for growth. This position will be part of the strategic management responsible for Talent Acquisition. The Manager will work with recruiting/hiring managers to fully understand their needs and generate candidate leads utilizing passive resources and effectively screening candidates. This highly attractive position will possess a flexible work arrangement with the ability to work from home.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years recruiting experience
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Demonstrable experience in tech industry recruiting and sales recruiting
  • Extensive knowledge of applicant tracking software programs
  • Familiarity with online job hunting websites
  • Ability to deliver results with little supervision, and to effectively manage multiple projects and candidates
  • Proven ability to build and maintain candidate pipelines, including using relationship management techniques, that yield high quality candidates for short and long term hiring needs *Evidence of building candidate relationships and managing a network of talent Superb customer focus, attention to detail, and organization skills

BENEFITS

Own Your Time
We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting.

Recharge Time
We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Care For Yourself
You’ll receive a health/wellness stipend that can go towards covering medical insurance, dental insurance, or joining a gym!

Focused Work
You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams.

Learn at your edges
We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here. And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Clevertech Swag
And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Apply for this position

https://hire.clevertech.biz/job/563963b0f3c394067e18f79f

Facebook User Acquisition Job at ConsumerAcquisition.com - AngelList
  • ConsumerAcquisiti...
  • Product
  • Jobs
  • Team
Applied
Apply Now
Add a message to ConsumerAcquisition.com
Apply
Share

Facebook User Acquisition at ConsumerAcquisition.com

San Francisco, Austin, Los Angeles, Remote · Full Time
Applied
Apply to ConsumerAcquisition.com
Add a message to ConsumerAcquisition.com
Apply

Job Description

Are you passionate about Facebook advertising and user acquisition? Do you want to deliver world-class performance to clients while having autonomy and personal freedom? If so, then we want to work with you!

We are looking for entrepreneurial individuals who are seeking an analytically challenging and strategic role with a fast-growing startup.

Manage all aspects of Facebook and Instagram advertising campaigns using our proprietary software, AdRules.
• Oversee execution and optimization of Facebook advertising campaigns to exceed clients’ goals across many verticals.
• Plan, manage, optimize, and report on paid social media campaigns.
• Become an expert in Facebook advertising and the AdRules platform.
• Write ad copy and work with graphic designers to optimize images.

Responsibilities:
• Manage all aspects of Facebook and Instagram advertising: build ads, analyze data, optimize continuously and manage creative testing.
• Develop strategies to exceed clients’ performance goals.
• Create images in Photoshop (or manage external designers) and write ad copy to optimize performance.
• Analyze your ad spend and use the data to formulate your strategy.
• Optimize ads for efficiency based on performance data using our AdRules platform.
• Develop client-facing skills on weekly calls, deliver strategic insights and daily summaries.

Requirements:
• Strong analytics, quantitative and problem-solving skills; ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendations.
• BA / BS / MBA or 2+ years’ experience in high-scale, hands-on performance marketing role with Facebook Ads and User Acquisition.
• Experience in performance marketing, online advertising, media buying, lead generation or consulting.
• Strong understanding of ads metrics (CPI, CTR, CPC, CPM, CPA, ROAS, ROI, LTV).
• Advanced knowledge of Excel.

Benefits:
• Highly competitive salary.
• Work from home flexibility.
• Uncapped vacation and sick time.

Skills
Facebook Advertising
Compensation
$80K–$160K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available
Applied
Apply Now
Add a message to ConsumerAcquisition.com
Apply

What We're Building

Founded in 2013, Consumer Acquisition offers the first end-to-end user acquisition solution with managed services, a creative marketplace for Facebook and Google ad creation and an AI-powered campaign automation platform with an action-based reporting.

We’ve created over 250,000 videos and acquired over 150 million app installs and leads for Glu Mobile, Lucktastic, PlayStudios, Nordcurrent, Checkout51, Blue Apron, Ford, PlayDots, EBATES and many more. We have a special CMO in-a-box startup package designed for VC-backed, pre-A Round companies.

Sales@ConsumerAcquisition.com

items.title: Talent Coordinator
items.content:
Since our UK launch in 2014, DICE has become the world's most innovative music discovery and ticketing platform. Fans are able to discover and find tickets to the hottest shows, club nights and festivals on the only live music discovery platform that’s built with the user in mind. Every event is handpicked by a team of show-obsessed experts.

DICE GETS FANS IN.

Some call it HR, here at DICE we call it the People Team - we're passionate about finding, growing and developing our amazing people at DICE. As a Talent Coordinator, you’ll play a proactive and cross-functional role working with all teams.

We’re looking for a Talent Coordinator who will take charge of all our coordination efforts to help scale our awesome teams. We’re recruiting globally across the entire business, spanning from software engineering and UX development through to brand partnerships and account management.

We’re on the lookout for a highly organised, adaptable, people person to support our recruitment efforts and expansion. You will be the first point of contact for anyone applying to DICE and responsible for ensuring that all DICE candidates feel valued, and receive an incredible candidate experience from start to finish.

Responsibilities:
*Effectively coordinating the full lifecycle of interviews for all DICE candidates across teams; ensuring a proactive and positive candidate experience
* Supporting the talent partner in ensuring our applicant tracking system is up to date and candidates are updated on next steps
* Manage our job adverts for all open positions, including our accounts with tools and platforms and updating our profiles where necessary
* Making candidates feel welcomed and providing them with a tour of our offices
* Working with our Creative and Branding team to create engaging content for our pages to improve our employee brand and attract quality candidates

Requirements:
* Demonstrable experience working within a people function role for 1-2 years (recruitment coordinator, HR assistant, etc.)
* Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken
* Motivated, exceptionally organised and detail oriented
* Ability to spin multiple plates - not afraid to take on multiple tasks but know how to prioritise to achieve deadlines
* Friendly, open-minded with a positive can-do attitude
* High EQ
* Creative problem solver
* Experienced dealing with sensitive information with the ability to work in a confidential manner
* Startup experience (bonus)

Benefits:
* Competitive salary
* Unlimited holiday
* Private Healthcare
* Mental Health and Wellbeing programmes
* Sanctus Coaches
* DICE Development Programme
* DICE credit to spend on gigs
* Regular socials
* Free breakfast
* We love our HQ in East London check it out "here":http://www.debeauvoirblock.com/#home

items.title: Internal Recruiter
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
items.content:
"ROLI is not only a learning-rich environment within your own discipline, but other team members

often make me question the world in new ways while we're eating lunch."

- Sarah Kosar, Head of Talent

ROLI is looking for an experienced, motivated, and thoughtful Internal Recruiter to join our Talent Team to help us continue to grow our global multidisciplinary team.
As a core member of our friendly and effective Talent Team, you will focus on direct sourcing our open and upcoming technical and non-technical positions, building talent pools that convert conversations into excellent candidate, brand and ultimately team member experiences. You will collaborate closely with the Talent Team on a wide range of the Talent Function including sourcing, role owner partnerships, employer branding, reporting, process improvements and more.

The Talent Team consists of our Head of Talent, Talent Manager and Talent Administrator. As a team, we believe in offering a superb candidate experience for everyone that takes part in our hiring process, whether that ends at the application stage or on their first day with us. We strive to offer an experience for candidates that is transparent and efficient as well as an opportunity for self-discovery along the way.

This role is most complimentary to someone who excels in a fast-paced atmosphere and is results driven. They will also be excited by solving challenges, building processes and bringing new people into an company and community where they will thrive.

This is a unique opportunity to grow our team and be a part of a disruptive category of music making devices we are creating called ‘Connected Music’ - a network of hardware and software, platform and developer products that will revolutionise how music is made. Join us to find more talented team members to help achieve our mission.

What you’ll do:

Develop, optimise and implement innovative methods to attract and source top talent, building and maintaining passive and active talent pools for a range of technical and non-technical roles across the business
Partner with key stakeholders and departments to understand their strategic direction and create appropriate short, medium and long term sourcing strategies to support this vision
Craft thoughtful, informative and tailored approaches to prospective candidates
Conduct phone screenings of prospective candidates sourced ahead of entering them into the hiring process
Ensure every conversation with a prospective candidate delivers a strong candidate and brand experience
Collaborate closely with the entire Talent Team on providing superb candidate and role owner experiences
Continuously develop a network of talent and industry contacts via direct sourcing as well as attend relevant meetups and industry events
Be an ambassador for the Talent Team, both internally and externally, promoting ROLI as a leading employer
Utilise sourcing and recruitment data to inform sourcing strategies and decision making
Be responsible and accountable for the accuracy of any prospective and sourced candidate data in our CRM and Applicant Tracking System (Greenhouse)

What you’ll need:

Proven experience and success hiring across a range of roles in a startup or fast-paced technology driven organisation
A balanced approach when screening and assessing the chemistry of a candidate’s fit for a position and their motivation alongside selling an opportunity
Working knowledge and experience with Applicant Tracking Systems (we use Greenhouse), social media and candidate platforms and hiring process workflows
An adept understanding of the current UK tech talent market
Resilience and the ability to manage competing demands, multiple searches, changing priorities and challenging deadlines with speed
Fantastic organisation skills with a methodical approach alongside a flexible attitude
An interest in sharing and receiving knowledge and feedback to grow the collective understanding and skill set of the Talent Team
An inquisitive mind and demonstrable examples of implementing proactive solutions
Excellent interpersonal and communication (both written and verbal) skills and the ability to work effectively with employees at all levels
A passion for music, technology, the arts and/or startups

Bonus points:

Experience as an in-house Recruiter
Proficiency in Google Suite and Apple computers
Experience recruiting at a high-growth, VC backed startup

ROLI offers:

The opportunity to work with the leading, progressive minds within technology, hardware, and music creation to directly impact the way we create and interact with music
A range of meaningful benefits including:
Generous parental leave policy
Flexible and remote work options
Wellness programme including weekly massages, guided meditation and yoga
Monthly “Friends and Family dinners”
Quarterly “Family Days”
A competitive health care cash plan
Daily complimentary homemade vegetarian lunch, as well as freshly baked bread, a breakfast bar and limitless home­made GOLDnola
The opportunity to nurture a new skill set in a 30 minute skill sharing session
A dedicated company-wide Hack Day every four weeks
2 social impact days and 20 hours per year dedicated to volunteering within the local community
A ‘Lending Library’ and generous team discount across all ROLI products
State of the art laptop of your choice and relevant software licenses for your role and beyond
A company backed pension scheme
A generous bike-to-work scheme plus in-house bike storage A competitive salary according to your level of experience

To learn more about us and our culture, check out:

Profile on ROLI Culture in The Guardian
See the Seaboard in action
Song maker kit with Marco Parisi
BLOCKS the modular music studio
Balderton Podcast - ROLI's company culture & building a unique team
Pharrell joins the team!
@ROLICareers
@CafeROLI
